events.name: Build a Stronger Email Marketing Channel
events.description:
Sign up here : http://bit.ly/2dFeLGB 


[What will you Learn] Email marketing is not dead.  In this 2 hours workshop, you will learn the best practices and fundamentals in building an email marketing channel. Specifically, you will learn: 。The fundamentals of effective email marketing  。How to improve your subject lines performance  。How to plan for an email marketing campaign and go beyond amateur  [Instructor] Ruben Hamilius, Head of Marketing, The HUB Singapore. Ruben started his career with Procter & Gamble now with The Hub Singapore. He is deeply passionate about marketing, consumers and new innovative products, with bias for growth. He helps startups grow and makes more amazing products by living by the principles of everything data-driven. 


[ Who should join ] 。People who are interested in digital marketing, email marketing。Aspiring entrepreneurs who want to launch their own product 


[ Workshop details ] 。Date: 16 Nov 16。Time: 3pm - 5pm。Venue: 43B Tanjong Pagar Road (level 3)。Price: SGD 15 *Admittance to the workshop is strictly for people who paid for the event only. 


____________ Policy:ALPHA Camp reserves the right to cancel or postpone the event due to unforeseen circumstances. In the event that the workshop is cancelled or postponed, all paid participants will be informed via email and full-refund will be given. Thank you!
events.location: Alpha Camp, 43B Tanjong Pagar Road, Singapore

events.name: VR Content: The Making Of
events.description:
MEETUP OVERVIEW For the last meet-up of the year, we will be discussing VR content creation. This year has been a roller coaster for VR, especially for hardware. But content will be key in sustaining this industry. We have invited some distinguished guests to talk about initiatives to encourage producers to create VR content, how VR content is conceptualized compared to traditional mediums, and the tools you can use to create simple VR content easily. Evening Rundown 7.00pm - Introduction/Asia VR Updates  A quick recap of the AsiaVR Association and introduction by our MC for the night, Roy Koo, Founder of IGNITE VR. 7:15pm - Abhi Kumar</a>, Chief Creative Director , Warrior9  Abhi believes that VR is the next step in the evolution of storytelling. He is currently working on developing the first sci-fi animated series in VR, The PhoenIX. Abhi will share about how Warrior9 conceptualizes and develops their VR content. 7:35pm - <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/donjanderson">Don Anderson, Head of Kids & Learning Partnerships, YouTube APAC, & Co-Founder, AsiaVR Assocation</a> Don will be sharing insights he gained from the MIPCOM conference that he attended in Cannes in October. VR was a key topic of the conference with its own track that covered topics like: "VR Content Workflow", "Beyond 360 - From Passive Viewing to Virtual Interaction", "VR & Immersive Journalism" and a 30 minute session called "<a href="https://soundcloud.com/user-374492226/mipcom-2016-getting-real-with-vr-where-is-the-money">Getting Real about VR: Where is the money?" Don's personal favourite was: "Disruptive Storytelling: Weaving Narratives into VR." 7:55pm - Andes Rizky, COO, Shinta VR Andes, who is also the founder of INVRA, will be sharing about MindVoke which is an application that allows you to create VR content easily. 8:15pm - Maxime Depondt, Creative Director, EON Reality Max will share about the new VR incubator from EON Reality and how it can benefit and give potential VR content creators a leg up. 8:30pm - Bryan Seah, Head of Original Productions (SEA), Discovery Networks Asia-Pacific Bryan will chat with us about the IMDA-Discovery $5 million year-long partnership. As an early adopter with a dedicated virtual reality (VR) application, 2017 will also see Discovery’s experienced global crew train local producers in VR technology – sharing their know-how and expertise on storytelling. The final films will break new ground and premiere on the Discovery VR application globally. Bryan will also share about the Discovery VR app and the content they are looking for.  8:55pm - Other Announcements + Event Closure  THIS IS A FREE EVENT (Live Broadcast viewable in our Facebook group) The AsiaVR Association is a non-profit association focused on promoting dialogue, debate, collaboration and investment in this rapidly evolving area of technology innovation. Our members come from a wide variety of disciplines, including user interface and application development through to VR documentary filmmaking and branded content creation. We welcome anyone interested in contributing to the discussion, or just wanting to come up to speed on this exciting new area, to join us. Do join our discussion in our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/asiavr/ 


In partnership with NUS Enterprise @ Blk71 (venue sponsor)  Let us know if you would like to subscribe to the NUS Enterprise Plug-In newsletter to receive updates about entrepreneur related events. For more information: http://www2.blk71.com/
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality Meetup Group
